text: Faisal II ( el-Melik Faysal es-Sânî) (2 May 1935 – 14 July 1958) was the last King of Iraq. He reigned from 4 April 1939 until July 1958, when he was killed during the 14 July Revolution. The only son of King Ghazi of Iraq and Queen Aliya, Faisal acceded to the throne at the age of three after his father was killed in a car crash. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:1958 deaths Category:Assassinated people Category:People from Baghdad Category:Kings of Iraq
title: Faisal II of Iraq
